item.title: Statistics 135: Concepts of Statistics (Spring 2020)
item.description:
Course Information

  • Professor: Adam Lucas
  • Office Hours: W 12-1pm, Th 1-3pm, F 9:30-10:30am
  • Lab Sections: F 12-2pm, F 4-6pm
  • Content: STAT 135 is Berkeley’s upper-division course on statistical theory and methodology for undergraduates in statistics and related fields. Topics include parameter estimation, hypothesis testing, statistical tests (parametric and non parametric) and linear regression (single and multiple).

I started to include reviewing materials in slides since the week of March 10 when the in-person classes are cancelled at Berkeley because of COVID-19. If you are interested in reviewing part 1 & 2, (i.e., parametric estimation and hypothesis testing), please feel free to go through Lab 7, in which I did a thorough review of what we have learnt during the first half of the semester. From Lab 7 onwards, you can find the reviewing materials in each lab by its title.

The following slides and all other teaching materials are made by me, so I take responsibility for any typo. The problem sets in the slides are from previous iterations of the class.

Materials

Class materials are not available during the final exam. They will be restored afterwards…

item.title: Statistics 2: Introduction to Statistics (Spring 2019)
item.description:
Course Information

  • Professor: Cari Kaufman
  • Office Hours: W, F 9-11am @ 426 Evans
  • Lab Sections: M, W 12-1pm @285 Cory; M, W 1-2pm @332 Evans
  • Content: STAT 2 is Berkeley’s introductory-level course on statistics for underguates. Topics include descriptive statistics, probability and inference.

item.title: Statistics 2: Introduction to Statistics (Fall 2018)
item.description:
Course Information

  • Professor: Cari Kaufman
  • Office Hours: F 11am-3pm @428 Evans
  • Lab Sections: M, W 1-2pm, 4-5pm @334 Evans
  • Content: STAT 2 is Berkeley’s introductory-level course on statistics for underguates. Topics include descriptive statistics, probability and inference.
